channel.title: math.GR updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GR updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: A note on the probability of a groupoid having deficient sets
item.description: arXiv:2407.16766v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A subset $X$ of a groupoid is said to be deficient if $|X \cdot X|\leq |X|$. It is well-known that the probability that a random groupoid has a deficient $t$-element set with $t\geq 3$ is zero. However, as conjectured in [4], we show that the probability is not zero in the case of sets of two elements and calculate the exact value. We explore some generalisations on deficient sets and their likelihoods.
item.dc:creator: Carles Card\'o

item.title: Commuting Involutions in Finite Simple Groups
item.description: arXiv:2407.16926v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove that if $G$ is a finite simple group and $x, y \in G$ are involutions, then $|x^G \cap C_G(y)| \rightarrow \infty$ as $|G| \rightarrow \infty$. This extends results of Guralnick-Robinson and Skresanov. We also prove a related result about $C_{G}(t)/O(C_G(t))$ that does not require the classification of finite simple groups.
item.dc:creator: Robert M. Guralnick, Geoffrey R. Robinson

item.title: A vanishing criterion for cup products and Massey products in bounded cohomology
item.description: arXiv:2407.17034v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We give a uniform vanishing criterion for products in bounded cohomology. This allows us to reprove and extend previous vanishing results for cup products and Massey triple products in the bounded cohomology of free groups and in the equivariant bounded cohomology of group actions on CAT(0) cube complexes.
item.dc:creator: Franziska Hofmann

item.title: Groups of F-Type
item.description: arXiv:2305.09818v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We consider a class of groups, called groups of F-type, which includes some known and important classes like Fuchsian groups of geometric rank $\ge 3$, surface groups of genus $\ge 2$, cyclically pinched one-relator groups and torus-knot groups, and discuss algebraic and geometric properties of groups of F-type.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Fine, Gerhard Rosenberger, Leonard Wienke

item.title: Free group of Hamel bijections of big size
item.description: arXiv:2405.00952v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: A $f\colon\mathbb{R}\to\mathbb{R}$ is called Hamel function if its graph is a Hamel basis of the linear space $\mathbb{R}^2$ over rationals. We construct, assuming CH, a free group of the size $2^\mathfrak{c}$ contained in the class of all Hamel functions, with the indentity function included. This answers, consistently, a question posed recently by M. Lichman, M. Pawlikowski, S. Smolarek, and J. Swaczyna.
item.dc:creator: Tomasz Natkaniec
